vocabularyItems.english: The voyage across the Atlantic Ocean lasted two weeks.
The school excursion to the zoo was exciting for children.
The expedition to Antarctica required careful planning and preparation.
We went on a Caribbean cruise for our anniversary.
The African safari allowed us to see wild animals.
Many people make a pilgrimage to holy sites annually.
My daily commute to work takes forty-five minutes exactly.
We were in transit for twelve hours during layover.
We have a four-hour layover in Dubai airport today.
The flight includes a stopover in Singapore for refueling.
Passengers will embark at gate twenty-three in ten minutes.
Please disembark through the rear door of the aircraft.
Please alight at the next stop for the museum.
The train will depart from platform four at noon.
Use the map to navigate through the unfamiliar city.
The captain steered the ship safely through the storm.
The ship's captain has thirty years of experience at sea.
The flight crew ensured all passengers were comfortable throughout.
Each passenger must show their boarding pass before entering.
The experienced traveler knows how to pack light efficiently.
The commuter train is crowded during rush hour mornings.
The train conductor checked all the tickets on board.
The porter helped carry our heavy luggage to room.
The chauffeur drove us to the airport in luxury car.
It's dangerous to hitchhike with strangers on highways alone.
We carpool to work to save money on gas.
The hotel shuttle runs every thirty minutes to airport.
The tram is a convenient way to travel downtown.
The trolley bus runs on electricity from overhead wires.
The subway is the fastest way to cross city.
The metro system operates from five in the morning.
The monorail connects the airport to the city center.
The old steam locomotive is now in the museum.
The first-class carriage offers comfortable seating and meals.
The cargo wagon carries goods across the country daily.
The freight train transports heavy goods between cities regularly.
The ship's cargo includes electronics and machinery items.
The large vessel can carry thousands of containers safely.
The ferry crosses the river every hour throughout day.
They sailed their luxury yacht around the Mediterranean Sea.
The small sailboat glided peacefully across the calm lake.
The motorboat sped across the water creating large waves.
We paddled the canoe down the peaceful river yesterday.
Kayaking in the ocean requires skill and good balance.
The wooden raft floated slowly down the wide river.
The submarine can dive deep beneath the ocean surface.
The aircraft landed safely despite the strong winds today.
The airplane flies at an altitude of thirty thousand feet.
The private jet can fly across continents without stopping.
The helicopter rescued people from the flooded area quickly.
The glider soared silently through the clear blue sky.
The hot air balloon floated gently over the valley.
The parachute opened perfectly and he landed safely on ground.
The airplane taxied slowly along the runway before takeoff.
The aircraft is stored in the hangar for maintenance.
The pilot sits in the cockpit and controls aircraft.
The fuselage is the main body of the airplane structure.
The propeller spins rapidly to move the plane forward.
The jet turbine produces enormous power for flight efficiently.
The pilot adjusted the throttle to increase engine speed.
Apply the brake gently to slow down the vehicle.
Press the accelerator pedal to make the car faster.
Release the clutch slowly when changing gears in car.
The gearbox allows you to change speeds while driving.
The automatic transmission makes driving much easier for beginners.
The car engine needs regular maintenance and oil changes.
The electric motor is quieter than gasoline engines always.
The chassis is the frame that supports the vehicle.
The rear axle connects the two back wheels together.
Good suspension makes the ride smooth and comfortable always.
The bumper protects the car in minor collisions effectively.
The fender covers the wheel and prevents mud splashing.
Open the hood to check the engine oil level.
Put the suitcases in the trunk of the car.
The windshield wipers clean rain from the glass window.
Check the rearview mirror before changing lanes on highway.
Always fasten your seatbelt before starting the car journey.
The airbag deploys instantly during a serious car crash.
Turn on the headlights when driving at night time.
Use the indicator when turning left or right always.
Don't honk the horn unnecessarily in residential areas please.
The speedometer shows how fast you are currently driving.
The odometer records the total distance traveled by vehicle.
The dashboard displays important information about the car's status.
The navigation system helps you find the best route.
We trekked through the mountains for five days straight.
We wandered through the old city streets exploring shops.
Wild animals roam freely in the national park area.
The explorers traversed the desert in search of water.
The embarkation point is at pier number seven today.
Disembarkation will begin shortly after we dock at port.
The brave voyager sailed across the ocean alone successfully.
The explorer discovered new lands during his expedition journey.
The wanderer traveled from town to town without destination.
Nomads move from place to place following their herds.
Many migrants travel to find better job opportunities abroad.
Refugees flee their countries due to war or persecution.
Many expatriates work in foreign countries for international companies.
Emigrants leave their home country to live elsewhere permanently.
Immigrants bring diverse cultures to their new countries always.

liarGameData.explanation: A2 learners confuse 'travel' (general activity), 'trip' (short journey), and 'journey' (long distance). Travel is uncountable, trip and journey are countable.
liarGameData.practice: I love travel (activity). I took a trip to Paris (short). The journey was long (distance).
liarGameData.tip: Travel = activity (no 'a'). Trip = short visit. Journey = focus on distance/time.
